tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_MULTIPLE_TIMELINE_EVENTS_BATCH
tools.description: Creates multiple immutable timeline events in a batch, ideal for bulk data imports or real-time synchronizations, using a valid event template; may update CRM properties if the template is so configured.

inputSchema.title: CreateMultipleTimelineEventsBatchRequest

items.title: InputsRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Optional unique identifier for the event. HubSpot will generate one if omitted. You can use `{{uuid}}` within the ID string (e.g., `my-event-{{uuid}}`) to ensure uniqueness if providing your own.

utk.title: Utk
utk.description: The HubSpot user token (utk) to associate the event with a contact. Recommended if the contact's email is unknown but a `usertoken` from a cookie is available.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the contact to associate with this event. Can be used to identify existing contacts, create new ones, or update the email of an existing contact if `objectId` is also provided.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: The domain name to associate with the event, often used with `utk` (user token) for analytics or contact tracking.

tokens.title: Tokens
tokens.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs, where keys are token names defined in the event template and values are the specific data for this event. All token values must be strings.

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: The unique identifier of the CRM object (e.g., company, deal) to which this event pertains. Required for all event types except contact events where `email` or `utk` can be used instead.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) ISO 8601 formatted date and time when the event actually occurred (e.g., '2023-05-15T10:30:00Z'). If omitted, HubSpot will use the time the event is processed. This timestamp influences the event's chronological position on the CRM object's timeline.

eventTemplateId.title: Event Template Id
eventTemplateId.description: The unique identifier of the event template to be used for creating the timeline event. This template defines the structure and properties of the event.

timelineIFrame__url.title: Timeline I Frame  Url
timelineIFrame__url.description: The URL of the content to be displayed within the iframe. This is required if the event template is configured to display an iframe.

timelineIFrame__width.title: Timeline I Frame  Width
timelineIFrame__width.description: The width of the iframe's modal window in pixels. Applicable if the event template uses an iframe.

timelineIFrame__height.title: Timeline I Frame  Height
timelineIFrame__height.description: The height of the iframe's modal window in pixels. Applicable if the event template uses an iframe.

timelineIFrame__linkLabel.title: Timeline I Frame  Link Label
timelineIFrame__linkLabel.description: The text for the link that, when clicked, will display the iframe. Relevant only if the event template uses an iframe.

timelineIFrame__headerLabel.title: Timeline I Frame  Header Label
timelineIFrame__headerLabel.description: The title or header label for the modal window that displays the iframe's content. Used if the event template includes an iframe.

items.description: Defines a single timeline event to be created as part of a batch.

inputs.title: Inputs
inputs.description: A list of event objects to be created. Each object in the list must conform to the InputsRequest schema and define a single timeline event.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a batch of timeline events.

webversion__expiresAt.title: Webversion  Expires At

rssData__blogEmailType.title: Rss Data  Blog Email Type

testing__abTestPercentage.title: Testing  Ab Test Percentage

rssData__blogImageMaxWidth.description: Maximum width for images imported from RSS feed blog posts. Applies if `rssData` is configured.

testing__abSamplingDefault.description: Default email version ('master' or 'variant') if A/B test results are inconclusive.

content__themeSettingsValues.title: Content  Theme Settings Values
content__themeSettingsValues.description: Custom values for theme settings applied to the email template.

testing__abSampleSizeDefault.description: Default email version ('master' or 'variant') if A/B test sample size is too small.

webversion__redirectToPageId.description: HubSpot page ID to redirect to from web version link; overrides `redirectToUrl`.

rssData__useHeadlineAsSubject.description: If true, email subject is first blog post headline. Applies if `rssData` is configured.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_PIPELINE_FOR_OBJECT_TYPE
tools.description: Creates a new HubSpot pipeline for a specified CRM `objectType` (e.g., 'deals', 'tickets'), requiring the pipeline `label` be unique for that `objectType` and each stage `label` be unique within the pipeline.

inputSchema.title: CreatePipelineForObjectTypeRequest

label.title: Label
label.description: A unique label for the pipeline, used for organization in the HubSpot UI for this object type.

items.title: StagesRequest

label.title: Label
label.description: A unique label for the pipeline stage, unique within the parent pipeline.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Stage-specific properties. For 'deals' pipelines, `probability` (a float between 0.0-1.0, in 0.1 increments) is required. For 'tickets' pipelines, `ticketState` ('OPEN'/'CLOSED') is optional.

displayOrder.title: Display Order
displayOrder.description: Display order for this stage. Stages with the same `displayOrder` are sorted alphabetically by label.

items.description: Defines a stage within a pipeline.

stages.title: Stages
stages.description: A list of stage definitions for the new pipeline; each stage `label` must be unique within this pipeline.

objectType.title: Object Type
objectType.description: Identifier for the CRM object type (e.g., 'deals', 'tickets', or a custom object type ID) for the new pipeline, determining its context and properties in HubSpot.

displayOrder.title: Display Order
displayOrder.description: Display order for this pipeline. Pipelines for the same object type with matching `displayOrder` are sorted alphabetically by label.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new pipeline for a specific object type.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_PIPELINE_STAGE
tools.description: Creates a new stage in a specified HubSpot CRM pipeline for a given object type, such as 'deals' or 'tickets'.

inputSchema.title: CreatePipelineStageRequest

label.title: Label
label.description: User-visible name for the pipeline stage, unique within the parent pipeline.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Stage-specific properties. For `deals` pipelines, `metadata` must include a `probability` key (value 0.0-1.0 in 0.1 increments). For `tickets` pipelines, an optional `ticketState` key can specify `OPEN` or `CLOSED` status.

objectType.title: Object Type
objectType.description: CRM object type (e.g., 'deals', 'tickets') for the new stage. Must be a valid HubSpot CRM object type supporting pipelines. Typically lowercase and plural.

pipelineId.title: Pipeline Id
pipelineId.description: Identifier of the existing pipeline (specific to `objectType`) where the new stage will be added.

displayOrder.title: Display Order
displayOrder.description: Stage's display order in the pipeline (lower numbers first). Stages with identical `displayOrder` are sorted alphabetically by `label`.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `CreatePipelineStage`

tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_PRODUCT
tools.description: Creates a new HubSpot product.

inputSchema.title: CreateProductObjectRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: The official name of the product.

price.title: Price
price.description: The selling price of the product in the default currency of the HubSpot account.

hs_sku.title: Hs Sku
hs_sku.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) for the product. This should be unique across all products if used for inventory management.

hs_url.title: Hs Url
hs_url.description: A direct URL link to the product's page on an e-commerce website or product information site.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The current quantity of the product available in inventory. This property might be relevant for physical goods.

hs_active.title: Hs Active
hs_active.description: Indicates if the product is currently active and available for sale. Set to `true` if active, `false` otherwise.

hs_images.title: Hs Images
hs_images.description: A comma-separated string of URLs for product images. The first URL is typically used as the primary image.

description.title: Description
examples: The Super Widget Model X offers enhanced durability and performance, perfect for industrial applications.
description.description: A detailed description of the product, its features, and benefits.

hs_archived.title: Hs Archived
hs_archived.description: Indicates if the product has been archived. Archived products are typically hidden from active lists and sales processes. Set to `true` to archive.

hs_featured.title: Hs Featured
hs_featured.description: Indicates if the product is marked as a featured item, which can be used to highlight it in product listings.

items.title: AssociationsRequest
TypesRequest

associationTypeId.title: Association Type Id
associationTypeId.description: Unique numeric ID of the association type defining the nature of the relationship (e.g., product to deal).

associationCategory.title: Association Category
associationCategory.description: The category of the association. Determines if the association is defined by HubSpot, a user, or an integrator.

items.description: Defines the type and category of an association between HubSpot objects.

types.title: Types
types.description: A list defining the types of associations. For product objects, this typically involves one type specifying the relationship.

to__id.title: To  Id
to__id.description: The unique ID of the target CRM object to associate with this product (e.g., a deal ID or company ID).

items.description: Specifies an association to be created between the new product and another HubSpot CRM object.

associations.title: Associations
associations.description: A list of associations to create between this new product and other CRM objects. Each association specifies the target object ID and the type of relationship.

tax_category.title: Tax Category
tax_category.description: The tax category or code applicable to the product, used for calculating sales tax (e.g., 'Taxable Goods', 'Non-Taxable').

hs_product_id.title: Hs Product Id
hs_product_id.description: An external or secondary unique identifier for the product. Useful for mapping to external systems. HubSpot does not auto-generate this.

hs_valid_from.title: Hs Valid From
hs_valid_from.description: The date (YYYY-MM-DD format) from which the product is considered valid or available for sale.

hs_product_type.title: Hs Product Type
hs_product_type.description: The general type of the product (e.g., 'Physical Good', 'Service', 'Software License').

hs_valid_through.title: Hs Valid Through
hs_valid_through.description: The date (YYYY-MM-DD format) until which the product is considered valid or available. Leave empty if there's no expiration date.

custom_properties.title: Custom Properties
custom_properties.description: A dictionary of custom properties for the product. Keys are the internal names of your HubSpot custom product properties, and values are the respective property values. Example: `{"material": "Titanium", "warranty_years": "5"}`.

hs_product_status.title: Hs Product Status
hs_product_status.description: The current sales or lifecycle status of the product (e.g., 'Available', 'Discontinued', 'Pre-order', 'Out of Stock').

hs_product_category.title: Hs Product Category
hs_product_category.description: The primary category the product belongs to (e.g., 'Electronics', 'Apparel', 'Consulting Services').

hs_cost_of_goods_sold.title: Hs Cost Of Goods Sold
hs_cost_of_goods_sold.description: The cost of goods sold (COGS) for the product. Used for profit margin calculations.

hs_product_subcategory.title: Hs Product Subcategory
hs_product_subcategory.description: A more specific subcategory for the product (e.g., 'Laptops' under 'Electronics').

hs_recurring_billing_period.title: Hs Recurring Billing Period
hs_recurring_billing_period.description: The billing frequency for recurring revenue products, formatted as a PnYnMnDTnHnMnS string (e.g., P1M for 1 month, P1Y for 1 year).

inputSchema.description: Request schema to create a new product object in HubSpot.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_PROPERTY_FOR_SPECIFIED_OBJECT_TYPE
tools.description: Creates a new custom property for a specified HubSpot CRM object type; ensure `groupName` refers to an existing property group for the `objectType`.

inputSchema.title: CreatePropertyForSpecifiedObjectTypeRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Internal programmatic name (snake_case), unique within the `objectType`, used for API referencing.

type.title: Type
type.description: The data type of the property.

label.title: Label
label.description: Human-readable label for the property shown in HubSpot UI.

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: If true, hides property in HubSpot UI, lists, and forms. Defaults to false if not set.

items.title: OptionsRequest

label.title: Label
label.description: Human-readable label for the option shown in HubSpot UI.

value.title: Value
value.description: Internal value of the option, used in API calls and must be unique among all options for this property.

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: If true, this option will not be displayed in HubSpot.

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional description for the property option.

displayOrder.title: Display Order
displayOrder.description: Controls display order of options, sorted ascending; -1 displays after positive values.

items.description: Request schema for individual property options, used when the property type is 'enumeration'.

options.title: Options
options.description: List of predefined options. Required if `type` is 'enumeration'. For `fieldType` of 'booleancheckbox', must include exactly two options with values 'true' and 'false'. Each option defines a possible value.

fieldType.title: Field Type
fieldType.description: Controls UI display and interaction method (e.g., text input, dropdown, checkbox).

formField.title: Form Field
formField.description: If true, property can be used in HubSpot forms. Defaults to false if not set.

groupName.title: Group Name
groupName.description: Name of the property group for organization in HubSpot UI.

objectType.title: Object Type
objectType.description: Target HubSpot CRM object type (e.g., contacts, companies) for the new property. Case-sensitive.

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional description for the property, displayed as help text in HubSpot UI.

displayOrder.title: Display Order
displayOrder.description: Controls display order of properties in HubSpot UI, sorted ascending; -1 displays after positive values.

hasUniqueValue.title: Has Unique Value
hasUniqueValue.description: If true, property's value must be unique across all records for the `objectType`. Cannot be changed to false after being set to true.

externalOptions.title: External Options
externalOptions.description: If true, 'enumeration' options are sourced externally, requiring `referencedObjectType` (e.g., 'OWNER' for HubSpot users). Defaults to false. Only for 'enumeration' type.

calculationFormula.title: Calculation Formula
calculationFormula.description: Formula for calculated property, required if `fieldType` is 'calculation_equation'. Can reference other properties by their internal names.

referencedObjectType.title: Referenced Object Type
referencedObjectType.description: For properties referencing other HubSpot objects (e.g., "OWNER" when `externalOptions` is true and `type` is "enumeration" to populate options with users). Applicable for specific property types.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new property for a specified HubSpot CRM object type.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_QUOTE_OBJECT
tools.description: Creates a new quote object in HubSpot CRM with specified properties and associations.

inputSchema.title: CreateQuoteObjectRequest

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs representing the properties of the quote to be created. Property names are HubSpot internal names.

items.title: AssociationsRequest
TypesRequest

associationTypeId.title: Association Type Id
associationTypeId.description: The ID that specifies the type of association. For example, to associate a quote with a deal, use the appropriate HubSpot-defined ID.

associationCategory.title: Association Category
associationCategory.description: The category of the association. HubSpot-defined associations are created by HubSpot, user-defined are created by users, and integrator-defined are created by integrations.

items.description: Request schema for defining an association type between objects.

types.title: Types
types.description: A list of association types to create between the new quote and other objects.

to__id.title: To  Id
to__id.description: The ID of the existing object to associate the new quote with.

items.description: Request schema for specifying associations to be created with the quote.

associations.title: Associations
associations.description: A list of associations to create for the new quote. Each item specifies the object to associate with and the type of association.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new quote object.

items.title: AssociationsRequest
TypesRequest

associationTypeId.title: Association Type Id
associationTypeId.description: Numeric ID representing the specific type of association.

associationCategory.title: Association Category
associationCategory.description: Category of the association (HUBSPOT_DEFINED, USER_DEFINED, or INTEGRATOR_DEFINED).

items.description: Association type descriptor for linking task with another record.

types.title: Types
types.description: List of association type descriptors defining how the task links to the target record.

to__id.title: To  Id
to__id.description: ID of the existing CRM record to associate with this task.

items.description: Defines an association between the new task and another CRM record.

associations.title: Associations
associations.description: Optional list of associations to link this task with existing CRM records.

hs_task_body.title: Hs Task Body
hs_task_body.description: Notes or body text of the task.

hs_task_type.title: Hs Task Type
hs_task_type.description: Type of the task (e.g., CALL, EMAIL, TODO).

hs_timestamp.title: Hs Timestamp
hs_timestamp.description: Task due date in ISO 8601 format or Unix milliseconds; required.

hs_task_status.title: Hs Task Status
hs_task_status.description: Current status of the task (e.g., WAITING, NOT_STARTED, COMPLETED).

hs_task_subject.title: Hs Task Subject
hs_task_subject.description: Title or subject line of the task.

hs_task_priority.title: Hs Task Priority
hs_task_priority.description: Priority level of the task (e.g., LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH).

hubspot_owner_id.title: Hubspot Owner Id
hubspot_owner_id.description: HubSpot user ID to assign this task to.

hs_task_reminders.title: Hs Task Reminders
hs_task_reminders.description: Reminder time for the task in Unix milliseconds.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a CRM task in HubSpot.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_TICKET
tools.description: Creates a new HubSpot ticket.

inputSchema.title: CreateTicketObjectRequest

content.title: Content
examples: Customer is unable to log in to their account.
Requesting assistance with billing cycle update.
content.description: Main body or description of the ticket, detailing the issue or request; typically required.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: Subject line or title of the ticket; typically a required field.

created_by.title: Created By
created_by.description: ID of the HubSpot user who created the ticket.

createdate.title: Createdate
createdate.description: Date and time the ticket was created (ISO 8601 format, e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ'); HubSpot typically sets this automatically if not provided.

hs_tag_ids.title: Hs Tag Ids
hs_tag_ids.description: List of tag IDs associated with the ticket for categorization or filtering.

closed_date.title: Closed Date
closed_date.description: Date and time the ticket was closed (ISO 8601 format, e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ').

hs_pipeline.title: Hs Pipeline
hs_pipeline.description: ID of the pipeline this ticket belongs to; often a required field.

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: Source channel through which the ticket was created (e.g., 'EMAIL', 'CHAT', 'PHONE', 'API').

items.title: AssociationsRequest

to.title: To
to.description: ID of the HubSpot object to associate with the ticket (e.g., a contact ID, company ID).

items.title: TypesRequest

associationTypeId.title: Association Type Id
associationTypeId.description: Unique ID of the specific association type (e.g., ID for 'ticket_to_contact' association).

associationCategory.title: Association Category
associationCategory.description: Category of the association.

items.description: Defines association types when linking HubSpot objects.

types.title: Types
types.description: List of association type definitions specifying the link between the ticket and the target object.

items.description: Defines an association between the new ticket and another HubSpot object.

associations.title: Associations
associations.description: List defining associations between this new ticket and other existing HubSpot objects (e.g., linking to a contact or company). Each item specifies the target object ID (`to`) and the type of association (`types`).

time_to_close.title: Time To Close
time_to_close.description: Time taken to close the ticket, often in milliseconds or ISO 8601 duration (e.g. 'PT2H30M').

hs_all_team_ids.title: Hs All Team Ids
hs_all_team_ids.description: List of all team IDs associated with this ticket; usually managed by HubSpot.

hubspot_team_id.title: Hubspot Team Id
hubspot_team_id.description: ID of the HubSpot team this ticket is assigned to.

last_reply_date.title: Last Reply Date
last_reply_date.description: Date and time of the last reply (either from agent or contact) on this ticket (ISO 8601 format).

hs_all_owner_ids.title: Hs All Owner Ids
hs_all_owner_ids.description: List of all HubSpot owner IDs associated with this ticket; usually managed by HubSpot.

hs_lastcontacted.title: Hs Lastcontacted
hs_lastcontacted.description: Date and time of the last contact associated with this ticket (ISO 8601 format).

hubspot_owner_id.title: Hubspot Owner Id
hubspot_owner_id.description: ID of the HubSpot user who owns this ticket.

custom_properties.title: Custom Properties
custom_properties.description: Dictionary of custom properties for the ticket: keys are internal names (e.g., `my_custom_field_name`), values are the data.

hs_pipeline_stage.title: Hs Pipeline Stage
hs_pipeline_stage.description: ID of the current stage of the ticket within its pipeline; often required and must belong to the specified `hs_pipeline`.

hs_primary_company.title: Hs Primary Company
hs_primary_company.description: ID of the primary company associated with this ticket.

hs_ticket_category.title: Hs Ticket Category
hs_ticket_category.description: Category of the ticket (e.g., 'Technical Support', 'Billing Inquiry'); values might be HubSpot-defined or custom.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_TIMELINE_EVENT_BASED_ON_TEMPLATE
tools.description: Creates an immutable custom timeline event on a CRM object's record using a specified, existing event template (identified by `eventTemplateId`), optionally updating CRM object properties if defined in the template; requires `email`, `utk`, or `objectId` for association.

inputSchema.title: CreateTimelineEventBasedOnTemplateRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Optional unique event identifier; HubSpot auto-generates if omitted. Use `{{uuid}}` for uniqueness if providing an ID.

utk.title: Utk
utk.description: HubSpot user token (e.g., from `hubspotutk` cookie) to associate event with a contact; use if contact's email is unknown.

email.title: Email
email.description: Email for contact-specific events; identifies existing contact, creates new, or changes email (if `objectId` provided).

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Domain associated with the event, often paired with `utk` for contact event context.

tokens.title: Tokens
tokens.description: Key-value pairs for populating dynamic content in the event template; keys are token names from the template.

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: Unique identifier of the CRM object (e.g., company, deal) for event association; required for non-contact objects.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: ISO 8601 UTC timestamp of event occurrence; defaults to current time. Determines timeline placement.

eventTemplateId.title: Event Template Id
eventTemplateId.description: The unique identifier of the event template, which must exist in HubSpot.

timelineIFrame__url.title: Timeline I Frame  Url
timelineIFrame__url.description: URL of content to display in the iframe.

timelineIFrame__width.title: Timeline I Frame  Width
timelineIFrame__width.description: Width of the iframe modal window (pixels).

timelineIFrame__height.description: Height of the iframe modal window (pixels).

timelineIFrame__linkLabel.title: Timeline I Frame  Link Label
timelineIFrame__linkLabel.description: Text for the link that opens the iframe modal with more details.

timelineIFrame__headerLabel.title: Timeline I Frame  Header Label
timelineIFrame__headerLabel.description: Title/header for the modal window displaying iframe content.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_CREATE_WORKFLOW
tools.description: Creates a new HubSpot workflow to automate processes; ensure `enrollmentCriteria` and `actions` use properties relevant to the specified `objectTypeId`.

name.title: Name
name.description: The unique name for the workflow.

type.title: Type
type.description: 'CONTACT_FLOW' for contact-based, 'PLATFORM_FLOW' for other object types.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: Action configurations defining workflow steps. Each action must include 'actionId' (required string) and 'type' (required string) fields, plus additional settings specific to the action type. Example: {'actionId': 'action-001', 'type': 'DELAY', 'delayMillis': 3600000}.

flowType.title: Flow Type
flowType.description: Category: 'WORKFLOW' for standard, 'ACTION_SET' for reusable action sets.

isEnabled.title: Is Enabled
isEnabled.description: Activate workflow upon creation (true) or create disabled (false).

dataSources.title: Data Sources
dataSources.description: Data source configurations for conditions or personalization.

description.title: Description
examples: This workflow nurtures new leads acquired through the Q1 campaign.
description.description: Explanation of the workflow's purpose and functionality.

timeWindows.title: Time Windows
timeWindows.description: Configurations for periods when workflow actions can execute.

blockedDates.title: Blocked Dates
blockedDates.description: Configurations for dates when workflow actions should not execute.

objectTypeId.title: Object Type Id
objectTypeId.description: HubSpot internal ID for the object type (e.g., '0-1' for Contacts, '0-2' for Companies).

customProperties.title: Custom Properties
customProperties.description: Custom key-value pairs for organization or tracking.

enrollmentCriteria.title: Enrollment Criteria
enrollmentCriteria.description: Configuration defining criteria for object enrollment. Must include 'groups' (array) or 'filterBranches' with nested 'filters' arrays. Each filter requires 'property', 'operator', and 'value' fields. Example: {'groups': [{'filters': [{'property': 'email', 'operator': 'HAS_PROPERTY', 'value': ''}]}]}.

suppressionListIds.title: Suppression List Ids
suppressionListIds.description: HubSpot list IDs for contacts to be prevented from enrollment.

unEnrollmentSetting.title: WorkflowUnenrollmentSetting

type.title: Type
type.description: Unenrollment behavior: 'ALL' from all other workflows, 'SELECTIVE' from specified workflows.

flowIds.title: Flow Ids
flowIds.description: Workflow IDs for unenrollment if 'type' is 'SELECTIVE'.

unEnrollmentSetting.description: Defines if/how objects unenroll from other workflows upon enrolling in this one.

canEnrollFromSalesforce.title: Can Enroll From Salesforce
canEnrollFromSalesforce.description: Allow contacts to be enrolled directly from Salesforce.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_DELETE_CONTACT_FOR_GDPR_COMPLIANCE
tools.description: Irreversibly deletes a HubSpot contact for GDPR compliance (identified via `objectId` and `idProperty`); an email `objectId` for a non-existent contact may be blocklisted.

inputSchema.title: DeleteContactForGdprComplianceRequest

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: The identifier (e.g., an email address or unique record ID) of the contact to be deleted for GDPR compliance, its type defined by `idProperty`.

idProperty.title: Id Property
idProperty.description: The HubSpot property name (e.g., 'email') specifying the type of `objectId` used for GDPR deletion of a contact. If omitted, `objectId` is assumed to be the contact's primary unique ID.

inputSchema.description: Input model for the `delete_contact_for_gdpr_compliance` action, specifying the contact to be deleted for GDPR compliance.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_DELETE_PIPELINE_BY_ID
tools.description: Permanently deletes a HubSpot pipeline and all its stages by `pipelineId` and `objectType`; this is irreversible, so use validation flags to avoid errors if the pipeline is not empty.

inputSchema.title: DeletePipelineByIdRequest

objectType.title: Object Type
objectType.description: Type of CRM object associated with the pipeline, determining which pipeline category is affected.

pipelineId.title: Pipeline Id
pipelineId.description: Unique identifier of the pipeline to be deleted.

validateReferencesBeforeDelete.title: Validate References Before Delete
validateReferencesBeforeDelete.description: If true, HubSpot checks for existing references to this pipeline before deletion to prevent data loss or orphaned records.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_INITIATE_DATA_IMPORT_PROCESS
tools.description: Call this action to start an asynchronous data import into HubSpot CRM using uploaded files and a detailed `importRequest` JSON configuration, ensuring this JSON correctly maps file columns to HubSpot properties and files align with these mappings.

inputSchema.title: InitiateDataImportProcessRequest

files.title: Files

name.title: Name
name.description: File name, contains extension to indetify the file type

files.description: The binary content of the file(s) to be imported. Supported formats typically include CSV, XLSX, and XLS. Ensure the file structure aligns with the mappings defined in `importRequest`.

importRequest.title: Import Request
importRequest.description: A JSON string specifying the configuration for the import process. This configuration dictates how data from the uploaded file(s) is mapped and imported into HubSpot. Key properties include `name` (a descriptive name for the import, e.g., "Q3 Contact Import"), `dateFormat` (e.g., 'MONTH_DAY_YEAR', 'DAY_MONTH_YEAR'), `importOperations` (defines if the import should create and update, only create, or only update records, e.g., 'CREATE_AND_UPDATE'), and `files` (an array detailing each file, its format, and `columnMappings`). The `columnMappings` are crucial as they map spreadsheet columns to HubSpot CRM object properties (e.g., map 'Email Address' column to 'CONTACT' object's 'email' property).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for initiating a data import process in HubSpot.

limit.description: The maximum number of feedback submissions to return per page. Using smaller values can lead to quicker responses, while larger values reduce the total number of API calls for large datasets.

archived.title: Archived
archived.description: Specifies whether to include archived feedback submissions. Set to `True` to retrieve only archived submissions. `False` (default) retrieves only active (non-archived) submissions. Useful for accessing historical or managing archived feedback.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: List of HubSpot internal property names to include for each feedback submission in the response (e.g., `hs_sentiment`, `hs_survey_name`, `hs_content`). If specified, only these properties are returned. If a property doesn't exist for a submission, it's ignored. If omitted, a default set of properties is returned.

associations.title: Associations
associations.description: List of object types (e.g., `contact`, `survey`, `ticket`) for which to retrieve associated IDs. This allows fetching IDs of related objects. If an association doesn't exist for a submission, it's ignored.

propertiesWithHistory.title: Properties With History
propertiesWithHistory.description: List of HubSpot internal property names for which to include historical values. The response includes both current and past values for these properties. Requesting history may affect the number of submissions returned per page due to increased response size.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `ListFeedbackSubmissionsPage`

tools.name: HUBSPOT_PERMANENTLY_DELETE_COMPANY_FOR_GDPR_COMPLIANCE
tools.description: Permanently deletes a company (identified by objectId) and its associated data from HubSpot for GDPR compliance; this action is irreversible and requires the company to exist.

inputSchema.title: PermanentlyDeleteCompanyForGdprComplianceRequest

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: The unique identifier of the company to be permanently deleted. If `idProperty` is specified, this is the value of that custom unique property. Otherwise, this is the company's HubSpot Company ID.

idProperty.title: Id Property
idProperty.description: Optional name of an alternate unique identifier property. If provided, objectId must be the value of this property for the company.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `PermanentlyDeleteCompanyForGdprCompliance`

tools.name: HUBSPOT_PERMANENTLY_DELETE_CONTACT_FOR_GDPR
tools.description: Irreversibly deletes a HubSpot contact for GDPR; if deleting by a non-existent email (using idProperty 'email'), the email is blocklisted instead.

inputSchema.title: PermanentlyDeleteContactForGdprRequest

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: The unique identifier of the contact to be permanently deleted. This can be the HubSpot contact ID (VID), or if `idProperty` is specified, it can be another unique property like an email address.

idProperty.title: Id Property
idProperty.description: Specifies the type of identifier provided in `objectId`. For instance, use 'email' if `objectId` is an email address. This field is optional and can be omitted if `objectId` refers to the HubSpot contact ID (VID).

inputSchema.description: Request to permanently delete a HubSpot contact for GDPR compliance.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_PERMANENTLY_DELETE_CONTACT_FOR_GDPR_COMPLIANCE
tools.description: Irreversibly erases a HubSpot contact and associated data per a GDPR request; if an email is given for a non-existent contact, it's blocklisted.

inputSchema.title: PermanentlyDeleteContactForGdprComplianceRequest

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: The contact's identifier (email or HubSpot ID, based on `idProperty`) for permanent deletion.

idProperty.title: Id Property
idProperty.description: Identifies `objectId` type: 'email' for email address, or null/omitted for HubSpot ID. 'email' is primary.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `PermanentlyDeleteContactForGdprCompliance`

tools.name: HUBSPOT_PERMANENTLY_DELETE_CONTACT_GDPR_COMPLIANCE
tools.description: Permanently and irreversibly deletes a HubSpot **quote** (not a contact, despite the action's internal naming) to comply with GDPR's 'right to be forgotten'.

inputSchema.title: PermanentlyDeleteContactGdprComplianceRequest

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: Unique identifier of the quote to be permanently deleted. This is the quote's HubSpot object ID, unless `idProperty` specifies an alternative unique identifying property.

idProperty.title: Id Property
idProperty.description: Name of the HubSpot quote property to use for quote identification if `objectId` is not the primary HubSpot ID. If omitted, `objectId` is assumed to be the primary HubSpot ID.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for the GDPR compliance deletion action, targeting quotes.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_PERMANENTLY_DELETE_CONTACT_VIA_GDPR
tools.description: Permanently deletes a HubSpot contact and all its associated data for GDPR compliance, identifying the contact by its ID or another unique property.

inputSchema.title: PermanentlyDeleteContactViaGdprRequest

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: The unique identifier of the contact to be permanently deleted. This could be the contact's HubSpot ID or another unique property value (e.g., email address) if `idProperty` is specified.

idProperty.title: Id Property
idProperty.description: The name of the property that contains the unique identifier of the contact specified in `objectId`. For example, if `objectId` is an email address, set this to 'email'. If `objectId` is the HubSpot contact ID, this field can be omitted or set to 'hs_object_id'.

objectType.title: Object Type
objectType.description: The type of HubSpot object to be deleted. Must be 'contacts' for this GDPR deletion endpoint. This parameter is part of the URL path.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `PermanentlyDeleteContactViaGdpr`

tools.name: HUBSPOT_PERMANENTLY_DELETE_DEAL_FOR_GDPR_COMPLIANCE
tools.description: Permanently deletes a HubSpot deal for GDPR compliance, identified by its unique ID or a specified property value; this action is irreversible and may blocklist the identifier if the deal isn't found when using `idProperty`.

inputSchema.title: PermanentlyDeleteDealForGdprComplianceRequest

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: Identifier of the deal to be deleted. If `idProperty` is specified, this is the value of that property; otherwise, it's the deal's unique HubSpot ID.

idProperty.title: Id Property
idProperty.description: The HubSpot deal property name that `objectId` refers to (e.g., 'email'); if omitted, `objectId` is the deal's unique ID.

inputSchema.description: Request to permanently delete a HubSpot deal for GDPR compliance.

tools.name: HUBSPOT_PERMANENTLY_DELETE_GDPR_CONTACT_AND_CONTENT

inputSchema.title: PermanentlyDeleteGdprContactAndContentRequest

objectId.title: Object Id
objectId.description: Value of the contact's unique identifier for permanent deletion. Must correspond to `idProperty` if specified, or to HubSpot's default unique identifier if `idProperty` is omitted.

idProperty.title: Id Property
idProperty.description: The contact property name to be used as its unique identifier. If not provided, HubSpot will use its default unique identifier for contacts.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `PermanentlyDeleteGdprContactAndContent`

tools.name: HUBSPOT_PERMANENTLY_DELETE_LINE_ITEMS_FOR_GDPR

idProperty.description: The name of the property that uniquely identifies the line item, if `objectId` is not its primary HubSpot ID. For example, 'external_id'. If omitted, `objectId` is assumed to be the line item's primary HubSpot ID.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `PermanentlyDeleteLineItemsForGdpr`
